container.heading: Escape Procedures and Notification of Escape from the Institution

para.text: In this chapter, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
Terms Defined.
"Escape" means when an eligible person leaves the confines of the Institution by:
Breaching the Institution's security perimeter;
Failing to return from an authorized prerelease status, that is, work release, school release, or day or overnight leave;
Escaping from escort officers while outside the confines of the Institution; or
Absconding from parole supervision.
"FBI" means the Federal Bureau of Investigation.
"Inmate" means an eligible person, as defined in COMAR 12.12.01.03B(9).

"Jessup Regional Emergency Warning System" means the mechanism through which the Jessup community and Jessup area correctional facilities are notified of escapes, the apprehension of escapees, and mass disturbances that have occurred in Jessup area correctional facilities. This mechanism includes a siren alarm, and a recorded telephone message concerning the incident. The telephone number through which the public may access the recorded message is 410-799-1136.

section.heading: Notification of Escapes from the Institution.

para.text: The Institution recognizes that secure confinement and sound security are the primary responsibilities of the Institution.

If an inmate escapes from the custody of the Institution or the reentry facility, the Director or officer in charge of the Institution at the time of the escape shall ensure that the following notifications are made upon receiving information of an escape:
Baltimore City Police Department, Central District;
Baltimore City Police Department, Fugitive Squad;
Baltimore City Jail;
Baltimore County Police Department, Major Case Squad;
Baltimore County Police Department, Investigative Division;
Baltimore County Police Department, Headquarters;
FBI, Fugitive Squad;
Maryland State Police, Waterloo Barracks;
Maryland State Police, Criminal Justice Information Systems/Central Repository;
Howard County Police Department;
Anne Arundel County Police Department; and
Division of Correction Investigative Unit.
In the event of an escape, the apprehension of an escapee, or a mass disturbance in the Institution, the Institution shall activate the Jessup Regional Emergency Warning System without delay.

The Institution shall notify the Investigation Unit of the Department if an inmate escapes, or attempts to escape, and it is suspected that an Institution employee or volunteer is involved in the escape or attempted escape through:
The commission of a criminal offense;
Neglect of duty; or
Violation of another Institution regulation that is applicable.
If an inmate escapes while under escort and away from the Institution, the Director shall ensure that the local police jurisdiction or precinct where the escape occurred is notified.

If an Institution escapee has a detainer for a sentence, concurrent or consecutive, and whether operative or not, the Director shall ensure that the jurisdiction which filed the detainer is notified of the escape within 24 hours of the escape. The Director shall ensure that the Institution sends a copy of the inmate escape work sheet, which references the detainer, to the concerned jurisdiction by transmittal letter.
The Director shall ensure that a copy of the inmate escape work sheet is placed in the inmate's base file and commitment file.
The Director shall ensure that the Office of the Secretary is notified in accordance with established procedures for reporting a serious incident.

In accordance with the provisions of Criminal Procedure Article, §11-1002, Annotated Code of Maryland, the Director shall ensure that the inmate's victim is notified, if the victim has filed a written request to be informed in the event that the inmate escapes.
The Director shall ensure that a telephone notification of an escape to the agencies listed in §B of this regulation is followed by written confirmation and an escape retake warrant.

When it has been confirmed that an inmate has escaped, the Director shall ensure that an escape retake warrant is issued. The Director shall ensure that the original warrant is mailed, using first class mail, and that a copy of the warrant is hand delivered, to the Maryland State Police, Waterloo Barracks.
The Director shall ensure that the following documents accompany the original escape warrant to the Maryland State Police Headquarters, Warrant Unit:
Original copy of waiver of extradition;
Copy of inmate escape work sheet; and
Other documents as requested by the Maryland State Police.

If the mailing of the original escape retake warrant is delayed for more than 24 hours, the Director shall ensure that the documents listed in §B of this regulation are mailed to the Maryland State Police Headquarters, Warrant Unit.
The following persons are authorized to issue an escape retake warrant:
Director;
Warden;
Assistant Warden; and
Institution shift commander.
Retake Warrant Control Log.
The Director shall establish procedures to maintain a control log, which shall include each escape retake warrant issued by the Institution.
The control log shall include the following information:
Escape retake warrant number;
Date and time of issuance;
Name and title of the authorized issuer;
Name and Institution commitment number of the escapee;
Date of the escape; and
Date the escape retake warrant was mailed to the Maryland State Police Headquarters.
The Director shall ensure that all retake warrant numbers are accounted for within the control log.
The Director shall ensure that the control log is accessible to appropriate staff in the event of a police inquiry.
The Director shall ensure that the Institution is specified as the point of return, and that the Institution's telephone number is listed, on each escape retake warrant issued.
The Director shall ensure that copies of the escape retake warrant are distributed as follows:
Inmate base file;
Inmate commitment file; and
Office of the State's Attorney for the jurisdiction from which the escape occurred.

section.heading: Return of an Escapee to the Institution.

para.text: The Director shall coordinate the return of an escapee from another state with the Maryland State Police.
An inmate who escapes from the reentry facility shall be returned to the Institution upon apprehension.
The Director shall ensure that the appropriate Institution adjustment action is taken against an inmate upon an inmate's return from escape.

When an escapee is returned to the custody of the Institution, the Director shall ensure that a letter notifying the Maryland State Police of the inmate's return is prepared, with copies provided to the agencies listed in Regulation .02B of this chapter.
The notification of return from escape may be completed on a monthly basis. The Director shall ensure that the notification of return from escape includes the following:
Name of the returned escapee;
Institution commitment number;
Date of the escaped inmate's return to the custody of the Institution; and
Escape retake warrant number.

The Director shall ensure that the inmate's victim is notified of the inmate's return to custody from escape, if the victim has filed a written request to be informed in the event that the inmate escapes.

The Director shall ensure that appropriate information is prepared for the State's Attorney's Office, regarding an inmate's return from escape, and forwarded by cover letter to the State's Attorney. The Director shall ensure that procedures are established to ensure that a copy of the letter sent to the State's Attorney is also sent to the Office of the Secretary.
The Director shall ensure that a copy of a cancelled escape retake warrant is placed in the inmate's commitment file.
